content.title: Convert HEIC to JPG Instantly
content.p1: Apple's High Efficiency Image Format (HEIC) is great for saving space on your iPhone, but it can be a nightmare to open on Windows, Android, or older software. Our HEIC to JPG Converter solves this problem instantly.
content.p2: We use advanced local processing capabilities to convert your photos without ever uploading them to a cloud server. This is the safest way to convert personal photos.

private.title: 100% Private
private.desc: Your personal photos stay on your device. We use client-side logic for zero-risk conversion.

compatibility.title: Broad Compatibility
compatibility.desc: Convert HEIC and HEIF files from any iOS version (iPhone/iPad) to universally accepted JPGs.

fast.title: Fast & Free
fast.desc: No software installation needed. Just drag, drop, and convert in seconds.

how_to.title: How to Convert HEIC to JPG?
list: Drag your .heic or .heif file into the upload zone.
The tool will automatically read and convert the file using advanced browser libraries.
See a preview of your converted JPG image immediately.
Click the "Download JPG Image" button to save it to your computer.

details.title: Technical Details
details.p1: HEIC (High Efficiency Image Container) uses modern compression methods to keep file sizes small. However, Windows and Android often struggle to open them.
details.p2: Our tool decodes the HEIC data and re-encodes it as a standardized JPEG image with 90% quality retention, ensuring your photos look great while being accessible everywhere.

faq.title: Common Questions
faq.q1: Can I convert iPhone Live Photos?
faq.a1: You can convert the still image part of the Live Photo if you transfer the .HEIC file to your computer first.
faq.a2: We use a high-quality setting (0.9 out of 1.0) to ensure minimal visual difference. JPG is a lossy format, but the difference is usually negligible to the human eye.

meta.title: Free Image Compressor - Reduce Image File Size Online

meta.subtitle: Reduce image file sizes without losing quality

editor.drop_title: Drop your image here or click to browse
editor.drop_subtitle: Drag and drop your image or click to select from your device

content.p1: Compress your images online for free with our powerful image compression tool. Reduce JPG, PNG, and WebP file sizes by up to 90% while maintaining excellent visual quality. Perfect for optimizing images for websites, social media, email attachments, and faster page loading times.
why_list: Faster website loading times improve user experience and SEO
Reduce bandwidth usage and hosting costs
Optimize images for mobile devices and slow connections
Meet file size limits for email attachments and uploads
Improve Core Web Vitals and Google PageSpeed scores
Save storage space on your device or server
quality_list: 100% - No compression, original quality (largest file size)
80-90% - High quality, minimal visible difference (recommended for most uses)
60-80% - Good quality, noticeable compression at high zoom
40-60% - Medium quality, visible artifacts but acceptable for web
10-40% - Low quality, significant quality loss (smallest file size)
content.how_desc: Our tool uses advanced compression algorithms to reduce file size while preserving image quality. For JPG images, we use lossy compression that removes imperceptible details. For PNG, we optimize the color palette and use efficient encoding. All compression happens in your browser - your images never leave your device.
best_list: Start with high-quality original images for best results
Use 80-90% quality for web images - perfect balance of size and quality
Compress images before uploading to websites or social media
Use JPG for photos, PNG for graphics with transparency
Consider WebP format for modern browsers (smaller files)
Always preview compressed images before downloading
Keep original files as backup before compression
content.privacy_desc: All image compression happens entirely in your browser using JavaScript. Your images are never uploaded to our servers, ensuring complete privacy and security. Your files never leave your device.

jpg.title: JPG/JPEG
jpg.desc: Best for photographs and complex images with many colors. Lossy compression.

png.title: PNG
png.desc: Best for graphics, logos, and images with transparency. Lossless or lossy compression.

webp.title: WebP
webp.desc: Modern format with superior compression. Smaller files than JPG/PNG with same quality.

faq.a1: Yes, but minimally. At 80-90% quality, the difference is imperceptible to the human eye. You can adjust the quality slider to find the perfect balance between file size and visual quality.
faq.q2: What's the difference between lossy and lossless compression?
faq.a2: Lossy compression (JPG) removes some image data to achieve smaller files, while lossless compression (PNG) reduces file size without losing any data. Lossy gives better compression but slight quality loss.
faq.q3: How much can I reduce image file size?
faq.a3: Typically 50-90% reduction depending on the original image and quality settings. Photos often compress more than graphics. WebP format provides the best compression.
faq.q4: Are my images uploaded to your server?
faq.a4: No! All compression happens in your browser using JavaScript. Your images never leave your device, ensuring complete privacy and security.
faq.a5: We support JPG/JPEG, PNG, and WebP formats. These cover 99% of web images. The tool automatically detects the format and applies optimal compression.
